description: 2-hour final exam covering content from the 2nd and 3rd lecturers, with short answers, paragraphs, drawings, or numerical responses. Tests understanding of transition metal complexes and organometallic chemistry.
Three take-home assignments (quizzes or structured research studies) related to lecture content. Designed to support understanding and provide feedback ahead of assessments.
45-minute test covering content from the first lecturer (bonding models and molecular structures). Includes short answers, paragraphs, drawings, or numerical responses.

Weekly lab classes involving pre-lab activities (quizzes, notebook preparation), in-lab procedures (preparing inorganic complexes, recording observations), and post-lab reports. Assesses safety, analysis, and communication of results.
